name: places/ChIJxeodkSlZwokRyaJVuE9gBvA
formattedAddress: 645 5th Ave 5th Floor, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 645 5th Ave 5th Floor, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text:
I wish I had read some reviews first before working with them it’s by far the worst customer service and experience I have ever had with a company ever. I had an issue receiving a shipping label to send my watch in took about two weeks. Then never received an offer for my watch contacted Instagram and finally got a call after a couple weeks. Then was told I already received an email that I never did then they finally sent it and then I still haven’t received the info for banking so I can be paid which is supposed to be automatic. They will never respond to voicemails, they do not respond to emails. Something that should take a few days has taken a month and still issues. Most unprofessional watch sellers. They also will tell you they will email you back and never do. Most common.

Update after. This finally got in touch with Cody who was very nice and respectful he did resolve  the issues and I’m able to make a deal and get paid

originalText.text: I would never again order from this company. Still waiting on a watch After 3 weeks. It finally gets to customs and FedEx tells me that they did not provide the correct paperwork. Almost impossible to get ahold of a live person at this company.  Please rethink ordering anything from this place . I own many watches and this has been the worst experience by far .

text.text: I would never again order from this company. Still waiting on a watch After 3 weeks. It finally gets to customs and FedEx tells me that they did not provide the correct paperwork. Almost impossible to get ahold of a live person at this company.  Please rethink ordering anything from this place . I own many watches and this has been the worst experience by far .

originalText.text:
Edit: Talked to a manager today and they did try to make the situation better. Still not ideal,  but I appreciated the effort. Upgrading from 2 to 4 stars because of it.
I wish I could recommend them, but I cannot. They sourced a specific Breitling I was looking for, but it was sourced to Nordstrom. So I contacted them to see if they could get it back from Nordstrom so I could buy directly them instead of Nordstrom. It felt like I was chasing the sales person down over and over and not making much progress.
Then during the watch hunt, Watchfinder & Co had a special of $500 off, with tax and stuff, saving me over $800. Ended up not hearing from sales person for a while, but bought it through Nordstrom and asked if there was anything they could do on their end to help make up the difference in price…because it was a watch from them being sold at Nordstrom. Not even on this purchase, but for a future purchase. Was told they could not. Which isn’t the frustrating part, it’s just frustrating the amount of communication and time I wasted with the salesperson, waiting for replies, creative solutions, anything and in the end had to just buy it from Nordstrom. Could’ve saved myself a lot of time if in the beginning they said it’s not possible, not dragging me along without reaching out, instead me initiating everything.
Very frustrating experience because they have a lot of great watches and was hoping to buy more pieces from them in the future.

originalText.text: Great service! I purchased a watch and had a concern about it Saeida and Daylan helped me send the watch back for reassurance. I received the watch back within a week. Their team is very professional and knowledgeable. Will be using again.

text.text: Great service! I purchased a watch and had a concern about it Saeida and Daylan helped me send the watch back for reassurance. I received the watch back within a week. Their team is very professional and knowledgeable. Will be using again.

originalText.text:
Update: after reading my review below, they contacted me, made excuses, and have now paid me.

This is very unfortunate and I hope a misunderstanding. I had read the reviews beforehand and trusted them. I was seeking to sell my watch. I made contact with Watchfinder and received an offer. I spoke with Jay, and he was prompt, attentive, and responsive. I shipped my watch to Watchfinder. Per FedEx, Watchfinder received my watch a week ago. Now Watchfinder is not responding to my emails, voicemails, or twitter messages. I believe they may have simply stolen my watch. I will be escalating through legal and advocacy channels. I wanted to make others aware so they do not fall victim.
